claim().details: User can claim based on the (unclaimed) number of tokens they own of the Quest

returns._0: The maximum amount of rewards that can be claimed by the protocol or the quest deployer

maxTotalRewards().details: Function that gets the maximum amount of rewards that can be claimed by all users. It does not include the protocol fee

returns._0: The maximum amount of rewards that can be claimed by all users

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause().details: Only the owner of the Quest can call this function. Also requires that the Quest has started (not by date, but by calling the start function)

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

queue().details: Requires that the balance of the rewards in the contract is greater than or equal to the maximum amount of rewards that can be claimed by all users and the protocol

returns._0: The amount of receipts that have been minted for the given quest

refund(address).details: transfer all coins and tokens that is not the rewardToken to the contract owner.

params.erc20Address_: The address of the ERC20 token to refund

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unPause().details: Only the owner of the Quest can call this function. Also requires that the Quest has started (not by date, but by calling the start function)

withdrawRemainingTokens().details: Every receipt minted should still be able to claim rewards (and cannot be withdrawn). This function can only be called after the quest end time

claim().notice: Allows user to claim the rewards entitled to them

isClaimed(uint256).notice: Checks if a Receipt token id has been used to claim a reward

maxProtocolReward().notice: Function that gets the maximum amount of rewards that can be claimed by the protocol or the quest deployer

protocolFee().notice: Function that calculates the protocol fee

queue().notice: Queues the quest by marking it ready to start at the contract level. Marking a quest as queued does not mean that it is live. It also requires that the start time has passed

withdrawRemainingTokens().notice: Function that allows either the protocol fee recipient or the owner to withdraw the remaining tokens in the contract

userdoc.notice: This contract is used to create a quest that rewards ERC20 tokens.
